column4: anyone have experience with TFTP and PXE booting? having a small problem cant seem to figure it out
Yes, I have a server mirroring dapper and edgy to a local lan here where they netboot and install.
What is the cause of your frustration involving pxe and tftpd ?
i followed http://www.howtoforge.com/ubuntu_pxe_install_server_p2 till the end of page two, the PXE boots and gets a dhcp ip addy but it says TFTP file not found
Yes, you have to enable it in the file /etc/default/tftpd
tried playing with it again and again :-) no luck findingthe file, when i do a tftp localhost i can see it though so i dont understand
did that, are you using tftp or tftp-hpa?
I have a good link for you. 1 minute
I use tftpd-hpa and my netboot root is /var/lib/tftpboot  where pxelinux.0 is. Under that is the pxelinux.cfg directory where the default boot file is
This is a good place to look at for conf settings and so on https://help.ubuntu.com/community/UbuntuOnCluster
The yp stuff you don't neccesarily need
unfortunately this computer is my pxe server so have to disconnect every time i wanna try it :0)

Those 2 sites I gave have between them pretty much all the stuff you need to do. If you need help with preseed files let me know, I had to reverse engineer mine but they auto setup over netboot fine now
cool thanks, actually just looking to get feisty on my coreduo but the cdrom drive burnt out
figured i could do it over pxe
Yeah it's a bit of a learning curve but works great once it's setup
